Command read_file returned: The text discusses various types of martial arts, including traditional and contemporary styles, armed and unarmed techniques, and those focusing on strikes, grappling, or both. Examples of specific martial arts mentioned include karate, judo, taekwondo, boxing, wrestling, fencing, Chinese wushu, kickboxing, Brazilian jiu-jitsu, aikido, and mixed martial arts (MMA). The text also notes the use of martial arts in self-defense, military, and law enforcement applications, as well as the health and fitness benefits of training. However, the text does not provide a comprehensive list of all types of martial arts.

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: Karate evolved over centuries in East Asia and was systematized in Okinawa in the 17th century by people who were forbidden to carry weapons. It was later imported into Japan in the 1920s. Karate has several schools and systems, each with different techniques and training methods. It emphasizes mental attitude, rituals of courtesy, costumes, and a complex ranking system by belt colour. Karate has some overlapping techniques with other fighting styles.
